A hands-on guide to grasping the moon's schedule for this special Friday, October 10, 2025.

The moon, eagerly awaited on Karwa Chauth, typically rises late in the evening. This timing aligns with the moon's natural orbit, its position relative to Earth, and the cosmic rhythm of the universe.
Karwa Chauth occurs on the fourth day (Chaturthi) of the Krishna Paksha, the moon's waning phase. Just days after the full moon, it rises later in the evening naturally.
The moon rises about 50 minutes later daily, so by the fourth waning night, moonrise occurs much later than on the full moon evening.
Your exact spot on Earth—latitude and longitude—sets when the moon rises, causing times to vary between cities.
